Fadl_body1: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them): The Prophet (peace be upon him) said, "There are no days in which righteous deeds are more beloved to Allah than these ten days." The people asked, "O Messenger of Allah, not even jihad in the way of Allah?" He replied, "Not even jihad in the way of Allah, except for a man who went out with his life and his wealth and did not return with anything." (Reported by Al-Bukhari)
Fadl_body2:
Regarding the virtue of fasting on Mondays and Thursdays:

Narrated by Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Deeds are presented on the day of Monday and Thursday, and I prefer that my deeds be presented while I am fasting."

Also, concerning the virtue of fasting on these days:

Narrated by Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The gates of Paradise are opened on Mondays and Thursdays, and Allah, the Almighty, forgives every Muslim servant who does not associate anything with Allah, except for a man who has enmity between him and his brother. It is said, 'Wait for these two until they reconcile, wait for these two until they reconcile, wait for these two until they reconcile.'"
Fadl_body3: Narrated by Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan and then follows it with six days of Shawwal, it will be as if he fasted for a lifetime." (Narrated by Muslim).
Fadl_body4:
Narrated by Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If you fast three days of the month, then fast the 13th, 14th, and 15th." Recorded by al-Tirmidhi, who graded it as a good (hasan) hadith.

Narrated by Qatadah ibn Milhan (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to instruct us to fast on the “white days”: the 13th, 14th, and 15th. Recorded by Abu Dawud.
Fadl_body5:
From Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him): The Prophet ﷺ said, "Fasting on the Day of Arafah, I hope, will expiate the sins of the previous year and the coming year." (Reported by Imam Muslim in his Sahih).

From Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "The Prophet ﷺ used to fast on the Day of Ashura." (Reported by Imam Muslim in his Sahih).

Fasting on the Day of Tasu'a: Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) narrated that when the Prophet ﷺ fasted on the Day of Ashura and was told that the Jews and Christians hold it in high regard, he said, "If Allah wills, next year we will fast the ninth day." However, the Prophet ﷺ passed away before the next year came.
Fadl_body6:
From Abu Qatadah Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was asked about fasting on the Day of Arafah, and he said, "It expiates the sins of the past year and the coming year."

From Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said, "There is no day on which Allah frees more people from the Fire than the Day of Arafah. He comes close and expresses His pride to the angels, saying, 'What do these people want?'" (Reported by Imam Muslim in his Sahih: 1348).

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Fasting on the Day of Arafah expiates the sins of the previous year and the coming year." (Reported by Imam Muslim in his Sahih: 1162).
Fadl_body7:
Actions that Invalidate Fasting (Mubtilat al-Siyam):

• Sexual intercourse during daylight hours in Ramadan.
• Ejaculation of semen deliberately.
• Eating and drinking deliberately.
• Swallowing anything that is in the nature of food or drink to reach the stomach.
• Vomiting deliberately.
• Menstrual or postpartum bleeding.

Undesirable Actions During Fasting (Makruhat al-Siyam):

• Excessive use of mouthwash or nasal irrigation.
• Kissing one's spouse when one cannot control their desires.
• Tasting food unnecessarily or swallowing saliva mixed with food remnants.
Advantage_body1: Fasting Tracker is a simple and user-friendly app designed to help Muslims track the days of fasting they intend to observe. The app allows users to input the number of days they need to fast and sends them daily reminders to fast until all days are completed.
Advantage_body2: We have added a night mode feature to the app to enhance the user experience for those who prefer this mode, ensuring their visual comfort.
Advantage_body3: All the fasting virtues mentioned in the app are sourced from the Quran and Hadith.
